conclusion: The shadow size and position are influenced by the distance from the light source, the shape of the object, and the angle of the light.
The objects are a cup, a piece of paper, an avocado, and a waffle. The shadows are cast on the ground.
The light source is positioned above the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
When the light source moves backward, the shadow will become larger because the light source is further away, and the shadow will spread out more.
The shadow of the cup, paper, avocado, and waffle will increase in size and move further away from the light source.

The shadow of the cup will be larger and more spread out. The shadow of the paper will be larger and more spread out. The shadow of the avocado will be larger and more spread out. The shadow of the waffle will be larger and more spread out.
The shadow of each object will increase in size and move further away from the light source.
The shadows will become larger and more spread out when the light source moves backward.
The shadows will become larger and more spread out.
